Ah -- I was using CrawlJob from what I think was the 1.6 release, and 
preRegister was simpler then. More from me after some more experimentation. 
I've gotten nothing but unhelpful nullPointerExceptions with uninformative 
stack traces so far.

 >>Another thing you might look at is that in the example you give above,
>you go direct to the Heritrix instance whereas in the progressStatistics
>example later, you are going via the MBeanServer.   Is that
>intentional?  Do one or the other I'd say and if the former, just go
>direct to the methods that Heritrix#invoke uses internally; this way
>you'll get a compile-time error rather than a runtime error if we change
>the API.

I'm probably being thick, but I don't see how it works to call 
Heritrix#invoke (rather than the MBeanServer) to do CrawlJob operations. 
Please point me to what I must be overlooking.

Thanks
Shifra
